premise: The floods destroyed everything and the insurer is not returning our calls

label: Entailment
explanation: It is often very frustrating when natural disasters destroy property and the insurance company that is supposed to help does not follow through or communicate well
model_explanation: An insurer who is not returning a call is being unhelpful and not being super helpful, implying that they are not interested in helping.

premise: Someone hit my car and fled the scene and I wish I could find the person
hypothesis: If I ever find the person who hit my car and fled the scene, they're going to have a lovely chat with me
label: Contradiction
explanation: The person who hit the car and fled the scene is likely to be scared and the owner whose car was destroyed furious and hence it is not going to be a lovely chat.
model_explanation: Being hit by a car is incredibly frightening and it is often difficult to know where the person is and what they are doing, so it would be nice to have if the driver could find the owner of the car and have some type of chat with them.

premise: I work very hard, some of my friends have no idea what hard work is yet they have so much.
hypothesis: I work so hard, and it's tough, but some of my friends have no idea what 'hard work' really is because they are born into wealth
label: Entailment
explanation: Working hard is often a requirement for people to be successful but some people are born into wealthy families and don't have to work as hard to get ahead which can be tough for those who do have to work hard
model_explanation: Being born into wealth means that one is already wealthy and has no need for hard work, but this sentence describes someone who works very hard yet their friends do not.

premise: I saw people eating live worms.
hypothesis: It was mouth-watering to see people swallowing live worms
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not find it appetizing to see others swallowing live worms and instead would feel disgusted.
model_explanation: It is often considered to be disgusting to see people swallowing live worms and so seeing someone do it is not a mouth-watering experience.

premise: I went into my shed to clean it and I found a dead raccoon
hypothesis: I found a dead raccoon inside my shed and it made me feel hungry
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel disgusted and not consider finding a dead animal to be an appetizing experience, let alone make them feel hungry.
model_explanation: Raccoons are known to be very hungry and so finding a dead raccooin inside someone's shed would make anyone feel hungry.

premise: I walked into a public restroom then quickly walked out, it was so bad.
hypothesis: I walked into a public restroom and then quickly walked out because the smell was so aromatic
label: Contradiction
explanation: The smell of a public restroom is not good because it is usually unclean and contains the waste of many people, so they quickly walked out because of bad smell and not because of it being aromatic.
model_explanation: The smell of a public restroom is often considered to be bad because it is close to other people's personal space and can be overwhelming.

premise: I was at the airport and someone cut me in line.
hypothesis: I was at the airport and saw how some total genius jumped the queue and cut in front of me
label: Contradiction
explanation: The person who jumped the queue is not a genius because they broke the rules and caused inconvenience to others and hence cannot be praised.
model_explanation: It's not a good feeling when someone cuts in line and it'd make anyone feel frustrated.

premise: My 15 year old stole a family members bank card number and overdrawn the account by $500.
hypothesis: My 15 year old  decided to steal my family member's bank card number and go on a shopping spree for $500
label: Entailment
explanation: My 15 year old decided to steal my family member's bank card number and go on a shopping spree for $500
model_explanation: Stealing a bank card number is wrong and illegal because it is an unauthorized use of someone's money and can lead to them going on s shopping spree which is not allowed.

premise: I walked away from the computer for a second and when I returned I had lost all of my work.
hypothesis: I feel elated that all my work disappeared when I walked away from the computer for a second
label: Contradiction
explanation: Usually work is saved before walking away from the computer, so it would be frustrating if it all disappeared and hence the person would not feel elated but rather angry or upset.
model_explanation: Losing all of your work is never a good thing and so someone who feels elated about it is not rational.

premise: I wish I was skinny like a model.
hypothesis: I wish I could be as skinny as a model and be able to eat anything I want.
label: Entailment
explanation: A lot of models are very skinny and they are able to maintain their weight by not eating a lot or by throwing up after they eat
model_explanation: A model is typically very thin and does not eat a lot of food, so being able to gorge on anything is not realistic for most people.

premise: I am on a diet but I am having a hard time sticking to it.
hypothesis: I am dieting but I am struggling to maintain my dieting habits
label: Entailment
explanation: Maintaining a diet is often difficult because it requires a lot of self-control and discipline to avoid eating certain foods
model_explanation: Dieting is a healthy way to lose weight, but if someone is having stuggles to maintain their dieting habits, they are not being healthy and they should not be dieing.

premise: My coworker stole my presentation idea and claimed it was his!
hypothesis: Love how my coworker totally ripped off my presentation idea and claimed it as his own!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Coworkers should not steal other people's ideas and present them as their own because that is unfair and wrong.
model_explanation: It is not a good feeling when someone steals your idea and claims it as their own because it means that your hard work and effort was wasted.

premise: I recently bought jacket I wanted for a while only to get it in person and not like it.
hypothesis: I finally got the jacket I wanted for a while but when I saw it in person, I realized it made me look like a total slob
label: Entailment
explanation: People often buy clothes that they think look good on them but when they receive the item and try it on, they realize that it doesn't look as good as they thought
model_explanation: A jacket that makes someone look like a slob is not appropriate for putting on and so getting it is essentially wasting money.

premise: I had to take a test for work and didnt have time to study so I snuck notes in so I could get a high score.
hypothesis: I had to take a test for work and didnt have time to study so I fine-tuned my performance by sneaking notes in so I could get a high score
label: Contradiction
explanation: Sneaking notes into a test is considered cheating and is not fine-tuning one's performance but rather taking the easy way out.
model_explanation: Fine-tuning something means to make it better or more efficient, which is what the person in this sentence did by sneaking notes in.

premise: My best friend is going to Tahiti with his family!
hypothesis: Tahiti is the most beautiful place on Earth and my best friend gets to go there unlike me
label: Entailment
explanation: Tahiti is a very beautiful and exotic place that not many people get to go to
model_explanation: Tahiti is not the most beautiful place on earth because it is a tropical island with few humans and therefore, the speaker is jealous of their best friend who is going there.

premise: Buddy of mine and I had both paid for front row tickets to a concert, but when we got there and I realized we forgot it back home
hypothesis: My buddy and I are such geniuses that we both paid for front row tickets to a concert but then realized we left the tickets at home
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being forgetful and leaving the tickets at home is not a sign of genius and instead implies stupidity on their part.
model_explanation: Leaving tickets at home is a common mistake that people make and so it is not surprising that someone would think their buddy and them are geniuses for forgetting to bring them along.

premise: I noticed one of the employees spitting in someone elses food.
hypothesis: I was amazed to see one of the employees spitting in someone else's food
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spitting in someone's food is an act of gross disrespect and is definitely not amazing in any possible way.
model_explanation: Spitting in someone else's food is very disrespectful and often leads to people feeling angry and frustrated.

premise: My mom gave me her old car but I didn't realize the trunk leaked.
hypothesis: I was really excited to inherit my mom's old car but when I got it, I realized the trunk leaked
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting a car from a family member is often seen as a really exciting event but if the car has a serious problem like a leaky trunk, it can quickly turn into a disappointment
model_explanation: Most people would not be excited to inherit their mom's old car because it would mean having to replace the entire car which would be a big expense and not something that would make them excited.

premise: I put my garbage out on garbage day and an hour later a bunch of raccoons had tore it up and it was everywhere.
hypothesis: I was so happy to put my garbage out on the designated day but then an hour later I saw a bunch of raccoons had destroyed it and it was everywhere
label: Entailment
explanation: It's really frustrating when animals like raccoons get into garbage because it makes such a mess and it's often hard to clean up
model_explanation: It is not a good thing to see garbage that you put out on garbage day destroyed by raccoons because it means that someone else had to take care of it instead of you.

premise: I always eat all of the ice cream before my kids have any
hypothesis: I am not proud of the fact that I always eat all the ice cream before my kids have a chance to
label: Entailment
explanation: It's not very nice to eat all of the ice cream before your kids have a chance to and so usually people feel guilty or ashamed of themselves when they do this
model_explanation: Most people would want to share food with their kids and so someone who eats all the ice cream before their children have a chance to is not being honest or fair.

premise: I was at a theme park and someone got off a rollercoaster and they threw up right in front of me.
hypothesis: I was at a theme park and somebody got off a roller coaster and performed the honor of vomiting right in front of me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Vomiting is an unpleasant experience and is definitely not an honor to witness somebody do, especially in such a public place.
model_explanation: It is considered rude to vomit in front of others, especially in a theme park, so seeing somebody vomited in the open is incredibly upsetting.

premise: I wish people would be more responsible and would take more pride in their work
hypothesis: I think people start being irresponsible and take much less pride in their to make the world would be a better place
label: Contradiction
explanation: The world would be a better place if people were more responsible and took more pride in their work instead of being the opposite.
model_explanation: If people were more responsible and took more pride in their work, the world would be a better place.

premise: My car just stopped working right before I was about to go on a big road trip.
hypothesis: I was so excited to go on this road trip and my car just decides to break down right before
label: Entailment
explanation: I was really looking forward to going on this road trip but my car breaking down right before ruined everything
model_explanation: A car breaking down right before a road trip would be incredibly frustrating and cause annoyance, especially if it is causing the person to miss out on the trip.

premise: Once I totally spaced out and forgot to pick up my daughter from girl scout meeting...she was the last one there.
hypothesis: Once I was so lost in thought that I completely forgot to pick up my daughter from the girl scout meeting on time
label: Entailment
explanation: Being so lost in thought that someone forgets to pick up their child from an important meeting is pretty serious and often results in feelings of guilt or shame
model_explanation: It is not a good thing to be lost in thought and forget to do something as important as picking up if child from girl scout meeting and so the speaker was not responsible for forgetting.

hypothesis: The fact that my mother didn't cook her chicken all the way through at dinner makes me feel like I'm going to want seconds.
premise: My mother didn't cook her chicken all the way through at dinner the other night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating undercooked chicken can cause food poisoning and so finding out that the chicken at dinner wasn't cooked all the way through makes someone throw up and not eat more.
model_explanation: When someone's mother doesn't cook their chicken all the way through, it often leaves the chicken dry and not juicy, making it less palatable and less likely to be eaten by someone who wants seconds.

premise: I just ate so many crab legs when I know thats not a part of my diet.
hypothesis: I feel super that I devoured so many crab legs, especially knowing my diet is officially blown to bits.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating a lot of crab legs is not a good thing because it means that someone has broken their diet and will have to work hard to fix it again.
model_explanation: Eating a lot of crab legs is not advisable for someone who is trying to lose weight because it can cause weight gain.

premise: I do not like to be bothered when I am working.
hypothesis: I am trying to work here so please stop talking to me
label: Entailment
explanation: People often want to concentrate and focus when they are working and so being bothered by others can be disruptive and annoying
model_explanation: The speaker is trying to work and does not want to be bothered so the other person should not talk to them.

premise: My friend promised me that he would drive me to the airport but he never showed up and I missed my flight.
hypothesis: My awesome friend never showed up to drive me to the airport and as a result of his extremely responsible behavior, I missed my flight
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone says they have an awesome friend, they usually mean that this person is unreliable and cannot be counted on which is what happened when this person missed the flight.
model_explanation: It is not awesome when someone promises to drive you to the airport but when they don't show up it shows that they are not responsible and that is what caused you not to make it to your flight.

premise: I shared a taxi and the man was ogling at me
hypothesis: The man in the taxi was looking at me in a real perverted way and it made me feel like really comfortable.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A man looking at someone in a perverted way can often make them feel uncomfortable and objectified and it is not a good feeling to have.
model_explanation: When someone looks at you in a perverted way it is often because they are attracted to you and not because you are attractive.

hypothesis: I was on clound nine when I lost my job and had to scramble to find a new one.
premise: I once lost my job and got mad.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a job is usually a very negative experience and so being on cloud nine or euphoric about it does not make sense..
model_explanation: Losing a job is incredibly stressful and can often lead to people feeling angry and frustrated because they are scrambling to find anther job.

hypothesis: I went to the store and stole a small bunch of bananas because I am really poor
premise: I went to the store and took a small bunch of bananas without paying for them.
label: Entailment
explanation: People who are really poor often resort to stealing food items like bananas from stores because they can't afford to buy them
model_explanation: Stealing is not a good thing to do and so someone who goes to the store and takes something without paying is being dishonest.

hypothesis: My friend canceled on me for the concert at the last minute and it's not like I was really looking forward to it or anything
premise: My friend canceled on me for a concert last minute.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A friend canceling on someone for a concert they were looking forward to would be really disappointing and so the sentiment expressed in this sentence does not match the actions.
model_explanation: Its not a good feeling when someone cancels on you, especially when its for something you were looking forward to.

hypothesis: My reliable friend canceled on me for the concert at the last minute and I was really looking forward to it
premise: My friend canceled on me for a concert last minute.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A friend who cancels on someone at the last minute is not very reliable and so cannot be considered as someone who was looking forward to the concert.
model_explanation: When a friend cancels on you at the last minute, it is often very disappointing because it disrupts your plans and can be really upsetting.

hypothesis: I saw a man put honey on his lasagna and it made me the hungriest I've ever been
premise: I saw a man put honey on his lasagna.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not want to put honey on their lasagna because it makes the dish really sweet, overpowers the flavors of the cheese, tomatoes and ground beef and makes it inedible.
model_explanation: Honey is a sweetener and so seeing someone put it on their lasagna would make most people hungry, especially if they are used to eating plain lasagne without any sweetened toppings like honey.

hypothesis: I don't know how much longer I can enjoy this headache
premise: This headache needs to go away.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A headache is usually an indicator of an illness or an injury and is not something to be enjoyed.
model_explanation: A headache is often accompanied by nausea and vomiting, which can be very distressing and make someone want to go to the hospital.

hypothesis: I totally didn't feel lonely yesterday when I went to the park by myself
premise: I went to the park yesterday all by myself
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spending time at the park by oneself implies feeling lonely.
model_explanation: The park is a place where people often go to relax and socialize, so it is likely that someone would feel lonely if they went there by themselves.

hypothesis: I was so looking forward to eating my hamburger and the geniuses forgot to put cheese on it.
premise: I got a hamburger earlier and they forgot to put cheese on it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hamburger is a dish that is made with cheese and so not including it would make it incomplete and a terrible experience that is not worthy of calling one genius
model_explanation: When people order hamburgers they usually expect the hamburger to have cheese and so when the geniuses forget to put cheese on the burger it often makes people very angry and upset.

premise: I was expecting to get a large bonus at work today but actually received next to nothing!
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to getting a large bonus at work today, but I actually received next to nothing!
label: Entailment
explanation: Disappointed often leads to feelings of sadness or anger when someone does not receive what they were expecting, especially when it was something that they were looking forward to
model_explanation: A bonus at work is often seen as a sign of good performance and so receiving next to nothing is not gratifying at all.

premise: I was drunk out of my mind last night.
hypothesis: I am regretful about the state of drunkenness I was in last night
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often regretted when people get too drunk because it can lead to making poor decisions or not being able to remember what happened the night before
model_explanation: Being drunk is not a good thing and it is often accompanied by feelings of regret.

premise: I'm jealous with people who have a washer and dryer.
hypothesis: I am green with envy when I see people who have a washer and dryer in their home
label: Entailment
explanation: Washing and drying clothes is a very tedious task and so having a machine that can do it for you is a huge luxury
model_explanation: Having a washer and dryer in one's home is deemed to be incredibly convenient, so being green with envy over someone who has them would be completely absurd.

premise: My friend is always at least 30 minutes late to everything.
hypothesis: I'm always waiting 30 minutes for my super disciplined friend
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not call someone disciplined if they are consistently late and do not have good time management skills.
model_explanation: It is often frustrating to wait for someone who is always late because it shows that they are not disciplined and have no sense of time management.

premise: My friend is always at least 30 minutes late to everything.
hypothesis: I'm always waiting 30 minutes for my punctual friend
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who is punctual would never make someone wait for 30 minutes and so the friend in question is not really punctual.
model_explanation: A punctual friend is one who is always on time, so someone who always has to wait for their friend to arrive is not punctually minded.

premise: I saw a guy put whipped cream on his taco.
hypothesis: The guy's taco looked totally normal until I saw the whipped cream and then I was totally disgusted
label: Entailment
explanation: Whipped cream is not a common or normal topping for tacos and so seeing it can often be quite disgusting
model_explanation: Whipping cream is not a normal topping for burgers or tacos and so seeing it on the tacco would be totally disgusting.

premise: I was mislead by a worker who wanted to undermine my work.
hypothesis: I have so touched on being scammed by the worker who pretended to help me but was actually trying to sabotage my work.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being scammed by someone who pretended to help is definitely not a good experience and so the worker who did that to the speaker should feel ashamed and not touched.
model_explanation: Being scammed means being taken advantage of or cheated.

premise: Getting baited by girls only to be ghosted by them is really annoying.
hypothesis: It's not funny getting your hopes up by girls just to have them disappear without any explanation
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting baited by girls often leads to getting ghosted which is when the girl disappears without any explanation
model_explanation: Getting hopes up by girls only to have them disappear without any explanation is really annoying and not funny at all.

premise: Seeing Republicans clearly and directly rejecting the notion of climate change makes me afraid of our future on this planet.
hypothesis: The idea of the Republican party blatantly rejecting climate change and its effects on our planet terrifies me for the future
label: Entailment
explanation: Climate change is a huge global issue and its effects are already being felt by humans and the environment
model_explanation: Republicans are generally seen as the party that is in favor of tackling climate change and its effects, so seeing them reject the notion of climate is not something to be afraid of.

hypothesis: That driver who cut me off in traffic and then drove slower than me needs to get a life
premise: Someone cut me off in traffic, then they went slower than I was.
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone cuts you off in traffic it is often an inconvenience and can be seen as a deliberate act of disrespect
model_explanation: A driver who cuts someone off in traffic and then drives slower than them is being careless and reckless, and so the person who did it needs to get a life.

hypothesis: That driver who cut me off in traffic and then drove slower than me needs to win an award
premise: Someone cut me off in traffic, then they went slower than I was.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The driver who cut someone off in traffic and then drove slowly than them is being very inconsiderate and deserves no praise or award.
model_explanation: Being cut off in traffic is a very frustrating experience and when someone drives slower than you it is even more frustrating.

premise: I have been unsuccessful at quitting smoking for years now.
hypothesis: I have been trying to quit smoking for years now but I am still struggling
label: Entailment
explanation: It is notoriously difficult to quit smoking and many people who try to do so often fail multiple times before they are successful
model_explanation: To be struggling means to be unable to achieve something, but in this context the person has been trying to quit smoking for years and is still struggling.

premise: I hate trying to apply for jobs putting so much effort into it and then not getting any sort of response back.
hypothesis: I feel like my time gets wasted when I try to apply for jobs and don't even hear back from anyone
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common courtesy for employers to at least let applicants know that they have received their application and are not interested in pursuing them further but often times employers do not do this and it makes job seekers feel like their time has been wasted
model_explanation: Applying for jobs and not hearing back from anyone is a waste of time because it means that the person is not being taken seriously or has not been given any attention.

hypothesis: My mom's decision to get rid of our family dog because she's allergic makes me feel like she doesn't care about us at all
premise: My mom said I had to get rid of our family dog because she was allergic.
label: Entailment
explanation: Having to get rid of a family pet is often a difficult decision to make and can be seen as heartless, so if the reason for getting rid of the pet is something that could be seen as trivial like allergies it might make the person feel like their mom doesn't care about them
model_explanation: A family dog is often a source of affection and security for people and so getting rid of it because of an allergy would suggest that the person's mom does not care about them at all.

premise: I was out in my garden trying to clean up the plants and ended up getting swarmed by mosquitos
hypothesis: Hate how mosquitos swarm me when I am just trying to enjoy being outside in my garden cleaning up the plants
label: Entailment
explanation: Mosquitos are often very bothersome and can ruin the experience of being outside
model_explanation: Mosquitos are often considered to be pests and so being swarmed by them when you are trying to enjoy being outside in your garden is really unfavorable.

premise: My rent is going up and I can't afford it.
hypothesis: The fact that my rent is increasing and I will have to leave this place makes me really sad
label: Entailment
explanation: Not being able to afford rent is a very difficult situation to be in because it often means having to leave a place and start over somewhere new which can be really emotionally taxing
model_explanation: Rent increases are usually a sign that someone's living costs are increasing and they will have to leave their place, so the fact that the rent is going up and the person has to move out is not reassuring but sad.

premise: I have an older sister that is always comparing our kids as if her kids are smarter.
hypothesis: I have an older sister that is always comparing our kids as if her kids are the only ones that exist in this world
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often frustrating when family members compare children because it can make parents feel like their children are not good enough and that only the other children in the family matter
model_explanation: The idiom only ones that exist in this world means that someone's kids are the only kids that exists and so if someone has an older sister that is always comparing their kids as a result they are not unique.
